image_1.description: Greg Mascher, 61, is a resident of East Palestine, raising his granddaughters and concerned about the health effects of a toxic spill. He is seen in an image wearing a black cap and a dark long-sleeve shirt, holding his granddaughter Raylix.

Raylix is Greg Mascher's granddaughter, who is worried about the train wreck and the potential health effects of the toxic spill. She is a young girl with light-colored eyes, wearing a gray hoodie, being held by an older man in an image.
A brown couch on which Greg Mascher and his granddaughter Raylix are sitting, located in East Palestine, the site of a toxic spill caused by a train derailment.

image_2.description: A wooden cabin with a steeply pitched roof covered in thick snow, located in East Palestine. The cabin has a small door and windows, indicating it is likely used for shelter or as a vacation home.
A thick layer of white snow covering the ground and the roof of the cabin in East Palestine, appearing to be deep and undisturbed, suggesting recent heavy snowfall.
Tall evergreen trees surrounding the cabin in East Palestine, partially covered in snow, indicating they are part of a forested area.

image_3.description: Joe Biden, also known as Joseph R. Biden Jr., is the current President of the United States. He is seeking to tax the rich and increase social aid in a budget proposal, aiming to reduce the budget gap by nearly $3 trillion over the next decade. Biden's recent focus includes deficit reduction and addressing concerns of the political middle, seeking to recapture a more centrist identity.

image_5.description: J.R. Smith, a former N.B.A. star, enrolled at an H.B.C.U. and joined the golf team after his basketball career ended. He is also seen in the image as an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt and shorts, swinging a golf club indoors.

image_6.description: Two hands with tattoos, one hand holding a golf ball.
A white golf ball being held by one of the hands.
J.R. Smith, a former N.B.A. star, enrolled at an H.B.C.U. and joined the golf team after his basketball career ended.
